A rear view of No. 54 Chrystie Street, east side, north from between Canal and Hester Streets.
About 1929.

(1)
Canal Street, north side, east from Chrystie Street. This view shows in the foreground a part of the vehicular approach to the Manhattan Bridge. This building is being demolished.

July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same view, but from a slightly different angle. This photo does not show the ground floor of the building.

July 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A view northward through a partially demolished wall of the Marcus Building. Note Libby's Hotel (Delancey Street) in the distance.

October 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

E 5 Negative # 3932

October 28, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

Chrystie Street, north from between Canal and Hester Streets.

June 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr,

Roosevelt (Sarah Delano) Park: Two views of the southern end of the cleared area that will form this East Side park. Chrystie Street bounds same on the right and Forsyth Street on the left. These photographs are in a southward direction to Canal Street and show the columnaded entrance to the Manhattan Bridge at that point. View 1 is from Broome Street, while No. 2 is from Hester Street.

October 7, 1930.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Roosevelt (Sarah Delano) Park: Two views of the southern end of the cleared area that will form this East Side park. Chrystie Street bounds same on the right and Forsyth Street on the left. These photographs are in a southward direction to Canal Street and show the columnaded entrance to the Manhattan Bridge at that point. View 1 is from Broome Street, while No. 2 is from Hester Street.

October 7, 1930.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

A general view northward along Chrystie (left) and Forsyth (right) Streets, from the Manhattan Bridge, at Canal Street, and showing clearance for the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park. Intersecting streets, shown in the order of their appearance, are Hester, Grand, Broome, Delancey, Rivington, Stanton and East Houston.

January 14, 1932.

International News Photo.

Chrystie Street, west side, north from but not including Canal Street, taken from Forsyth Street. The clearance in the foreground is the site for Roosevelt Park.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
